title: Marinated Olives
introduction: Marinated olives are an exquisite way to start a meal. With their rich flavors derived from a combination of spices and oils, these olives are sure to be a hit. Whether you prefer a mild black olive like Gaeta or a mix of green and black varieties, these marinated olives are the perfect accompaniment to a rustic loaf of bread.

ingredients.name: Gaeta or other mild black olives

instructions.direction: Rinse the olives under cold running water. Drain well and pat dry with paper towels.
With a swivel-blade vegetable peeler, remove two 2-inch strips of the yellow zest of the lemon. Avoid digging into the white pith, or remove the pith with a knife.
Combine all of the ingredients in a container and stir well. Cover and refrigerate, shaking the container occasionally, for 1 week. Serve at room temperature.

variations.variation: Add hot pepper for a spicy kick.
Incorporate fresh herbs for added aroma.
Include celery leaves or strips of sun-dried tomatoes for extra texture and flavor.
